item.title: MSL Global Limited Appoints New CFO as Part of Strategic Leadership Shift
item.description: Top News MSL Global Limited Appoints New CFO as Part of Strategic Leadership Shift 39 minutes ago Madhusudan Securities has appointed Vishwanatha Srinivas as the new Chief Financial Officer (CFO), effective December 9, 2025, following the resignation of Sausan Bukhari. Srinivas brings over 20 years of experience in finance and related fields. Bukhari will step down to focus on broader strategic initiatives and long-term planning as a board member. The change aims to strengthen the company's financial management and strategic direction.

item.title: EIA Raises Brent Crude Price Projections for 2025 and 2026
item.description: EIA Raises Brent Crude Price Projections for 2025 and 2026 29 minutes ago The Energy Information Administration (EIA) has modestly increased its Brent crude oil price projections. For 2025, the forecast has been raised by $0.15 to $68.91 per barrel. The 2026 projection has been increased by $0.16 to $55.08 per barrel. These small upward revisions suggest a slightly more optimistic outlook on medium-term oil prices, potentially reflecting changes in global oil market dynamics.

item.title: ICICI Prudential AMC Announces IPO: 5% Shares Reserved for ICICI Bank Shareholders
item.description: ICICI Prudential AMC Announces IPO: 5% Shares Reserved for ICICI Bank Shareholders 3 hours ago ICICI Prudential Asset Management Company is launching an IPO of 48,972,994 equity shares with a price band of ₹2,061 - ₹2,165 per share. The IPO will open on December 12, 2025, and close on December 16, 2025. A special reservation of up to 2,448,649 equity shares (5% of total offer) is set aside for eligible ICICI Bank shareholders, with a minimum bid of 6 shares and a maximum bid of 90 shares. This move provides ICICI Bank shareholders a preferential opportunity to invest in the AMC's growth.

item.title: EPL Limited Expands Thai Operations with ₹148.32 Million Investment
item.description: EPL Limited Expands Thai Operations with ₹148.32 Million Investment 1 hour ago EPL Limited has invested 5.15 crore Thai Baht (₹148.32 Million) in its wholly-owned subsidiary, EPL Packaging (Thailand) Co. Ltd. The investment involves subscribing to 514,800 new shares at 100 Thai Baht per share. Lamitube Technologies Ltd., another wholly-owned subsidiary of EPL, subscribed to an additional 5,200 shares. The ownership structure remains unchanged with EPL Limited holding 99% and Lamitube Technologies Ltd. holding 1%. This move aims to strengthen EPL's manufacturing and trading capabilities for laminated tubes in Thailand. The investment formalities are expected to be completed by January 15, 2026.
